page.title: 20Wildlife (cont)
page.content: Crows Very common in the area. Pigeons Many pigeons, wood-pigeons and other varieties are to be found in the area and are a real headache to farmers who use many methods to try to keep these pests away from crops. Partridge These attractive little wild game-birds are very common in the area. They nest under bushes or trees. Ducks There are several types of duck in the area Mallard being the most common. Curlew Easily identified by its mournful, eerie cry and its long curved beak. Numerous small birds, sparrows, tits, robins, thrushes, finches etc abound in the area feeding on the plentiful supply of seeds, berries and insects.
